intro: Gremy, A ZeroNet User, I think.

post.body: Does anyone else think that the "ZeroNet" name is a very anime name to call an internet? I can't help but pronounce it in my head like a Japanese commercial lady.

Hey anon, do you want to debate anarchism over a decentralized p2p reddit clone?
It's the future~

Daily reminder that CatChan exists on the 0Net and you should contribute.
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1Q8KDxfQNe1yN9XzXhu1ZisYEyVnUkif2J/?/cat/
Hmm, there seems to be inconsistencies between KrosoZeroNet and the normal AppNet. Some posts on here only show up on the proxy server. Anyone else having that? üçû
Text goes behind everything else if you extend the typing window. Literally unusable.
Apart from the obvious new options, is there any difference between using ZeroMe and ZeroMe+?

comment.body: Why do you think they shouldn't?~
How else will you know if you posted something?
@Nekololi: Don't click it, no matter what. If you unfollow yourself you will never be able to find your true self ever again (or know when you posted something).

Take it with a grain of salt cause I'm not 100% sure, but, as far as I know there are no problems in doing this. How ZeroNet works is by saving all the necessary files into that data folder and then distributing them. So if you keep that folder you can have your ZeroNet anywhere. If you have a blog with only yourself as a peer then you might want to be careful if you keep copying the data folder, cause you might paste the one with old content over the new one and overwrite it, losing some info, but that's if you delete the new one/aren't careful.
Not for now, You'll have to post the 127 or the zeronet.korso.win/ if you wanna share it to people outside of the zeronet.
@Th3B3st: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1Lj1oPcN7oZQL8HkS5KbkzQuKqs42zQWY6 a few new options such as block/hide people/posts and the like.
@Loligod: Oh I only just noticed, that could be a problem. Tbh updating the main one with the blocks seems like the best choice.
